definition: An administrative unit or organization that is part of or operates under the authority of a government, established to perform specific public functions, implement policies, or provide services to citizens.
opposite_reasoning: PrivateOrganization provides the strongest and most semantically clear opposition to GovernmentAgency. It captures the fundamental public vs. private sector distinction that is both conceptually robust and practically useful for AI safety applications. This opposition is taxonomic (mutually exclusive organizational types), has high availability in both WordNet and SUMO, and would be valuable for distinguishing government vs. private sector contexts in monitoring systems. For Fisher-LDA, this provides a clean axis: government-authorized public service vs. privately-operated independent organization.
